verbs.description: unpin (third-person singular simple present unpins, present participle unpinning, simple past and past participle unpinned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To unfasten by removing a pin.
(transitive, computing, graphical user interface) To detach (an icon, application, etc.) from the place where it was previously pinned.
examples: to unpin a program from the Taskbar

entries.meaning: (programming, transitive) To undo the pinning or fixing of (an array in memory, a security certificate, etc.) so that it can be modified again.
examples: […]  you can use the GCHandle class mentioned earlier to pin a heap block until you explicitly unpin it.

entries.meaning: (transitive, chess) To get (a piece) out of a pin.
